title: bacterial-genomics/wf-paired-end-illumina-assembly pipeline parameters
description: Trim, assemble, and annotate paired end illumina reads.

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to samplesheet ** OR ** directory containing FastQ read sets. Recognized extensions are .fq, .fastq with optional gzip compression.

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

min_filesize_fastq_input.description: Minimum file size of input FastQ files.

logpath.description: The output directory where pipeline information will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

host_remove.description: Remove host reads from FastQ files

min_filesize_fastq_sra_human_scrubber_re.description: Minimum output filesize for each FastQ file after sra-human-scrubber

min_filesize_fastq_hostile_removed.description: Minimum output filesize for each FastQ file after hostile

hostile_host_reference_path_prefix.description: Prefix path to hostile bowtie2 index files to use for removal

sra_scrubber_db.description: Database for NCBI's SRA Human Scrubber .db file
sra_scrubber_db.help_text: Path to a local file, or a URL to .DB file format that contains NCBI's STAT k-mers to remove from reads.

min_filesize_broken_pairs_bbtools_repair.description: Minimum output filesize for each FastQ file after BBTools Repair on SRA-Human-Scrubber reads

depth.description: Coverage depth to subsample FastQ files to.

genome_size.description: Genome size to subsample FastQ files to.

spades_mode.description: SPAdes: Data type flags to add to SPAdes when assembling contigs.

spades_polish_corrections.description: SPAdes: Number of rounds to correct contigs from SPAdes using cleaned paired-end reads.

skesa_vector_percent.description: SKESA: Percentage of reads containing 19-mer for the 19-mer to be considered a vector.

skesa_steps.description: SKESA: Number of assembly iterations from minimal to maximal kmer length in reads.

skesa_fraction.description: SKESA: Maximum noise to signal ratio acceptable for extension

skesa_min_contig_length.description: SKESA: Minimal contig length reported in output.

skesa_allow_snps.description: SKESA: Allow additional step for snp discovery.

min_filesize_raw_assembly.description: Minimum file size of raw assembly file formed from the assembler software package.

min_filesize_non_overlapping_fastq.description: Minimum file size of non-overlapping FastQ files.

min_filesize_filtered_assembly.description: Minimum file size of assembly file after biopython filters away contigs.

min_filesize_binary_pe_alignment.description: Minimum file size of binary cleaned paired-end alignment file after paired-end reads are mapped onto the filtered assembly.

min_filesize_polished_assembly.description: Minimum file size of assembly file after SNP and InDel corrections.

min_filesize_final_assembly.description: Minimum file size of the final error-corrected contigs.

min_filesize_binary_se_alignment.description: Minimum file size of binary singleton alignment file after singletons are mapped to final assembly file.

phix_reference.description: File containing PhiX sequences in FastA format.
phix_reference.help_text: Path to PhiX reference file in FastA format. Recognized extensions are: {.fasta, .fas, .fa, .fna}.

min_filesize_phix_genome.description: Minimum file size of input PhiX reference file.

min_filesize_fastq_phix_removed.description: Minimum file size of FastQ files after PhiX is removed.

adapter_reference.description: File containing Illumina adapters in FastA format.
adapter_reference.help_text: Path to adapter reference file in FastA format. Recognized extensions are: {.fasta, .fas, .fa, .fna}.

min_filesize_adapters.description: Minimum file size of input adapter reference file.

min_filesize_fastq_adapters_removed.description: Minimum file size of FastQ files after adapters are removed.

kraken1_db.description: Database for taxonomic profiling with kraken.
kraken1_db.help_text: Path to a local directory, archive file, or a URL to compressed tar archive that contain files `database.{idx,kdb}` and `taxonomy/{names,nodes}.dmp`.

kraken2_db.description: Database for taxonomic profiling with kraken2.
kraken2_db.help_text: Path to a local directory, archive file, or a URL to compressed tar archive that contain `{hash,opts,taxo}.k2d` files.

blast_db.description: Database for 16S ribosomal RNA analysis with BLAST's 16S ribosomal RNA database.
blast_db.help_text: Path to a local directory, archive file, or a URL to compressed tar archive that contains BLAST 16S ribosomal RNA files.

filter_blast_column.description: Report best BLASTn hit per query label (1st column) or target (2nd column).

genbank_query.description: String to search each defline in genbank file for extraction.

genbank_query_feature.description: GenBank feature type to search in genbank file for extraction.

genbank_query_qualifier.description: Qualifier term within each genbank feature to search in genbank file for extraction.

genbank_search_type.description: Type of query match to search in genbank file for extraction.

min_filesize_blastn_db.description: Minimum file size of 16S BLASTn database files.

min_filesize_blastn_output.description: Minimum file size of the output file generated by BLASTn.

min_filesize_extracted_ssu_file.description: Minimum file size of the file containing extracted 16S rRNA gene sequences.

min_filesize_renamed_ssu_file.description: Minimum file size of SSU extracted file that gets renamed to contain sample identifiers for each sequence.

filter_contigs_coverage.description: Minimum coverage of each contig, where an integer is an absolute coverage and a float is a minimum percentage, when filtering contigs.

filter_contigs_discard_file.description: Output FastA file of discarded sequences which includes failed filters in the deflines when filtering contigs.

filter_contigs_gcskew.description: Keep >88 and <12% GC contigs when filtering contigs.

filter_contigs_length.description: Minimum contig length (in bp) when filtering contigs.

filter_contigs_keep_low_complexity.description: Keep low-complexity contigs with only 1 or 2 nucleotides represented when filtering contigs.

filter_contigs_deflines.description: Rename and/or retain deflines when filtering contigs.

filter_contigs_no_sort.description: Skip sorting contigs by descending length when filtering contigs.

min_filesize_filtered_blastn.description: Minimum file size of file containing the top 16S BLASTn alignments.

gtdb_db.description: Database for contig taxonomic classification with GTDB-Tk.
gtdb_db.help_text: Path to a local directory, archive file, or a URL to compressed tar archive that contains GTDB-Tk database.

mash_db.description: Database using within GTDB-Tk for ANI screening.
mash_db.help_text: Path to a local file or a URL a file that contains the Mash database that ends in `.msh`.

gtdbtk_pplacer_scratch.description: Reduce pplacer memory usage by writing to disk (slower).

gtdbtk_min_perc_aa.description: Exclude genomes that do not have at least this percentage of AA in the MSA (inclusive bound).

gtdbtk_pplacer_cpus.description: Number of CPUs to use during pplacer placement.

gtdbtk_min_af.description: Minimum alignment fraction to assign genome to a species cluster.

busco_db.description: Database for intra-contig gene analysis with BUSCO.
busco_db.help_text: Path to a local directory, archive file, or a URL to compressed tar archive that contains BUSCO lineages. Can either be a lineage dataset or entire BUSCO database.

skip_busco.description: Skip BUSCO classification of each contig.

busco_config.description: Path to configuration file for BUSCO.

split_multifasta_remove_gaps.description: Remove gaps from contigs when splitting contigs for BUSCO analysis.

split_multifasta_extension.description: File extension of contig file whens plitting contig file.

prokka_curated_proteins.description: Additional protein encoding genes to use with Prokka.

min_filesize_annotated_genbank.description: Minimum file size of annotated genbank file.

merge_lanes.description: SAMPLESHEET ONLY: Merges multiple lane files into one.

excel_sheet_name.description: EXCEL SAMPLESHEET ONLY: Sheet name of Excel (.XLSX, .XLS) samplesheet.

profile_options.title: Profile options
profile_options.description: Parameters to select which profile to use.

profile_cache_dir.description: The output directory where process module containers and/or conda environments will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

max_job_request_options.title: Max job request options
max_job_request_options.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.
max_job_request_options.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that you can not _increase_ the resources requested by any job using these options. For that you will need your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

max_cpus.description: Maximum number of CPUs that can be requested for any single job.
max_cpus.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the CPU requirement for each process. Should be an integer e.g. `--max_cpus 1`

max_memory.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be requested for any single job.
max_memory.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the memory requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_memory '8.GB'`

max_time.description: Maximum amount of time that can be requested for any single job.
max_time.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the time requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_time '2.h'`

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

hook_url.description: Incoming hook URL for messaging service
hook_url.help_text: Incoming hook URL for messaging service. Currently, MS Teams and Slack are supported.

tracedir.description: Directory to keep pipeline Nextflow logs and reports.

process_log_dir.description: Directory to keep output and error logs from each process.

qc_filecheck_log_dir.description: Directory to keep QC file checks from processes.

validationShowHiddenParams.description: Boolean whether to show hidden parameters at runtime

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

show_hidden_params.help_text: By default, parameters set as _hidden_ in the schema are not shown on the command line when a user runs with `--help`. Specifying this option will tell the pipeline to show all parameters.
